column4: Alright, so... about upgrading to dapper. "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" just said "nothing to do!"
Yeah, didn't work for me.
Which was surprising.
then you missed a step :-)
did you update your sources.list?
Ah-hah!
I was surprised that was not mentioned in the instructions.
Probably should be.
And where is the canonical sources list for dapper?
!tell phyzome about repos
blaze try symlinking /var/www to somewhere else
thug no
So, there is no command to upgrade?
I have to explicitly modify sources.list?
thug fat32 has both
the instructions tell you to use update-manager
I know, it didn't work for me.
blaze after you changed the file, did you stop and start apache?
Right. Both tell me that my system is up to date.
yeah
how carefully did you read the instructions?
I thought fairly carefully.
it says the update manager will initially tell you that your system is up to date but that you must click "check" in order to upgrade
